Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: Looking for a developer (or potential partner) to develop smart contracts with Komodo. If you have prior experience with smart contracts with Ethereum/solidity that would be an advantage (yet not necessary). Understanding of scaling a must. Initial offer is for a short period (2 weeks), with potential long term contract > 2 years. We're a Dutch company, healthy and 8+ years in production (being a native Dutch speaker would be great, yet not mandatory). Our core team is 5 people, with a range of freelancers a grand total of 20. Oh, and we publish comics and games. DM me, if you feel you're up for the job with a short intro about you, your skills and what you have done with Komodo so far. ‚ù§

Author: LeshAft9#0083
Content: Is the DPOW centralized? i.e. what is signing BTC transactions every 10 minutes

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: One of a random 64 Notary nodes that are elected.  8 ( I believe) Are automatically provided to developers to provide income and resources - 24 are Automatically renewed each year if they are top performing - 32 new ones are elected each election period annually, the next one hopefully being in April/May.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
Notaries only additional authorities are to mine blocks at a lower difficulty so they can input the hash of KMD and it's asset chains onto BTC. 
They cannot change the blocks, add or remove transactions or censor anything that passes through.  
They simply have lower mining difficulties in order to facilitate the Hash Recording to BTC.  

As I understand it on a "simple" level.  
Hope that helps @LeshAft9
